title: Sion's rework is by far the most outstanding reworks i have ever seen
body:
i really hope all reworks be done like his

i don't mean in terms of abilities, i mean in terms of theme, you really feel like you're playing an aggressive warrior, a REAL juggernaut, an undead, and his abilities REFLECT that, his quotes ALSO reflect that, like that joke towards urgot (i love those small things) and i absolutely LOVE the interaction between champions whether it's a joke/taunt  


so Riot, are all reworks going to follow Sion's Example in terms of following each theme?

replies.body: I agree, I never played sion before the rework but I play him now. Everything about him is awesome.

What the hell?

Old Sion wasn't bad. You could have built him AP or AD. New Sion is nothing more than a meatshield tank.

I played old Sion a few times, and no, he was bad as fuck in the worst ways. His lore screamed 'Juggernaut' but his best builds were pure AP (WHY THE FUCK IS THE VICIOUSLY STRONG AND POWERFUL JUGGERNAUT BUILDING LIKE A MAGE AND SHOOTING EYE BEAMS?) or pure AD. Additionally, his gameplay was EXTREMELY binary; as AP he walked up with W, Q'd you, then burst W and walked away. You had no way to counter him outside of never being in range, and Sion was basically useless past 15 minutes or if his opponent bought any MR item. As AD, he literally farmed for 40+ minutes, then waddled into range and autoattack drain tanked and hoped he lived. He had almost no active skills as AD (Shield was useless, stun was only for getting in range, and E+R were both passive effects that buffed his autoattacks) and his entire damage was useless if you had any form of peel. He was a horribly unfocused kit that did not ever satisfy what his lore promised.

Sure, new Sion is extremely different. He's also not a shitty 2 button kit that is either useless past 15 or useless until 40.

Oh, but now having a timed Q with the same exact W and a armor reducing E isn't linear and binary at all?
Having a R that is used in the same fashion every time it's cast isn't linear and binary?

At least with the Old Sion his kit could go both ways and he had multiple types of play styles.  The new Sion is a complete blowout, and the only reason any of you say he's good is because you've either seen a Pro play it, or you've watched it on Esports.

> Oh, but now having a timed Q with the same exact W and a armor reducing E isn't linear and binary at all?
Having a R that is used in the same fashion every time it's cast isn't linear and binary?

His Q is a really interactive skill. His W lasts less and only needs 2 seconds to be reactivated (iirc), it also scales with his maximum health and with his opponent's maximum health so it's not useless if you aren't building AP. His E is really interactive, too. His R can be used for multiple purposes.

There are a lot of things you can say against Sion, but he is not binary at all.

I'm really glad you're enjoying the new Sion as much as we are. We definitely hope to try and build on the learnings from what we did with him for future large champion updates (see poppy, urgot, taric, yorick etc). 

The goal is to take the core of what was really resonant and good about the old champion and try to enhance and deliver on it rather than discard. This often doesn't mean that you keep the exact abilities and art details, but everything we make for the updated champion should feed back into that core theme. A coherent and consistent champion leads to the most fun and compelling character. 

All of the feedback we get from the community (positive and negative) helps us improve and find inspiration for how to keep elevating LoL to be a more fun and competitive experience.

Any chance you guys are going to look back at the post-Sion redesigns while you're at it?  Karma may have finally become viable but she lost literally *everything* thematic about her kit in her redesign, mantra is just a binary DPS steroid, you use it whenever it is up to deal your max damage.  The whole theme of duality between yin and yang, offense and defense, war and peace were all just flat out removed for yet another poke/zone/utility sparkflinger kit that lends nothing to the characters identity.

The possibility of taking a look at champs that we have already reworked in the past is there for sure. Most likely it won't be for a while as there are some other champions with much bigger problems that we hope to solve first.

Q and W should still do what they do now but with more finesse and skill attached to them. I liked the idea of his W being a channel that breathed fire in a cone after the cleanse and heal over time. Q could easily either be a skillshot or switch between range and melee, sword or gun. His Gold mechanic on his Q could easily be a money bag version of Thresh's Souls as his innate Passive.
You can sleep easy, critplank will still be a thing.

One more question if I may, not sure if you can answer because it does have to do with future content, but also with Xeraths redesign.

Are we going to see another siege-tank champ added to the game to replace Xeraths redesign that removed that theme?

I'm okay with Xerath losing his siege-tanky-ness, the whole "Ascended mage" and "siege tank" hooks never fit together anyway and his siege tank mechanics always felt kind of watered down (though I do think current Xerath could use a little love regardless of that, Ryze and Brand are only two of several examples that feel like they fit the 'overwhelmingly powerful mage' shtick better than Xerath does.)

But that playstyle of sieging an enemy with powerful ranged AoE at the cost of all mobility is one I _desperately_ want to play with in game, and champs are being released so infrequently these days I'm afraid I'm going to be old and gray before I see it happen. :-/
There is hope! :D Thank-you.

He doesn't have a TARGETED stun (or any stun at all actually, only knock ups and a slow).  His passive doesn't feel at all like his old ult, so I wouldn't count it (probably because you don't attack as fast, old ult was an AS steroid too).

He went from high AD, lifesteal, team healing bruiser to high CC lockdown and initiation tank.  The only things he kept were infinite health and a shield he can detonate to do damage.
